strapiArticle.title: Ginataang Gulay
strapiArticle.description: Vegetable dish cooked in coconut milk.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as squash, string beans, okra, eggplant, and leafy greens), cut into bite-sized pieces
  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 cup vegetable broth or water
  • 1 small onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, peeled and minced
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • 1 tablespoon shrimp paste (bagoong) (optional, for added flavor)
  • Salt, to taste

Instructions:

  1. In a large pan or pot, heat the cooking oil over medium heat.

  2. Saut√© the garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant and the onion becomes translucent.

  3. Add the mixed vegetables to the pan and stir-fry them for a few minutes until slightly tender.

  4. Pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth or water. Stir to combine.

  5. If using shrimp paste, add it to the pan and stir it into the mixture. This is optional but adds a savory flavor to the dish.

  6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are fully cooked and tender.

  7. Season with salt to taste.

  8. Remove from heat and transfer the Ginataang Gulay to a serving dish.

  9. Serve hot with steamed rice. The creamy and flavorful coconut milk sauce pairs well with the vegetables.

Ginataang Gulay is a comforting and satisfying dish that highlights the natural flavors of the vegetables combined with the richness of coconut milk. Enjoy!
